title: Resistivity - battery and resistor L x s x s

content.question: A battery of <math alttext="e m f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>emf</mi></math> <math alttext="script uppercase E" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi></math> is connected to a resistor, as shown in the figure. The resistor is made from a material of resistivity <math alttext="rho" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>ρ</mi></math> and is in the shape of a rectangular solid with length <math alttext="L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>L</mi></math> and a square cross section of side length <math alttext="s" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>s</mi></math>. What is the current in the resistor?

choices.label: <math alttext="script uppercase E times rho, times L" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>Ɛ</mi><mi>ρ</mi><mi>L</mi></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator script uppercase E, and denominator rho times L, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mi>Ɛ</mi><mrow><mi>ρ</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator script uppercase E times rho times L, and denominator s squared, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>Ɛ</mi><mi>ρ</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow><msup><mi>s</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mfrac></math>

<math alttext="the fraction with numerator script uppercase E times s squared, and denominator rho times L, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>Ɛ</mi><msup><mi>s</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>ρ</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction with numerator script uppercase E times s squared, and denominator rho times L, end fraction" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mrow><mi>Ɛ</mi><msup><mi>s</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></mrow><mrow><mi>ρ</mi><mi>L</mi></mrow></mfrac></math>

skill.text: 2.A: Derive a symbolic expression from known quantities by selecting and following a logical mathematical pathway.
